TopicTitle: Russian inspired manned trip to Duna. 6 launch orbital construction.

Articles.Content:
All craft files located in imgur comments.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Really cool and compact design! Nice job!
Might just try something like this. Really cool.
Only con is that your refuelled doesn't have enough to refill the whole ship but I think I will have enough fuel.

I attempted to do something similar, with bobcats soviet pack back in .20, according to my tester( I never could assemble it it in orbit) it failed horribly because of a lack of thrust. I should have found a RD-0410(Russian style NTR) to help.

could you make a completly stock version of this? My RAM (and conscience) hate MJ. And put the craft files up in one place? They are hard to click

It is stock. I just used mechjeb on the pictures.

Engine: http://d.pr/f/F0Va Habitat: http://d.pr/f/KrXj Crew: http://d.pr/f/fm6B Lander: http://d.pr/f/Iu8

GUYS IT IS STOCK PEOPLE READ THE THREAD TITLE MECHJEB IS JUST FOR CALCULATIONS ON HIS VERSION!!

Sorry don't want people to not want it jus because they think it is modded.
Btw I added RCS on the lander because how the heck do I dock it then do anything?
I was trying to cut down on parts. The crew part has rcs. I figured as long as one piece had rcs i could dock everything.

Sry but that is not how it works. You see, imagine the constructin of the ISS(or MIR). Imagine only the core module had RCS. So every time a new module arrived the whole thing had to go for docking and use its tiny RCS thrusters. Same here, I mean if every part has balanced RCS each one can be easily docked. The ship with the engine and c few modules might not have had perfectly balanced RCS. That is why everyone puts RCS on every individual part of the ship for easy construction.
That is fantastic! U make me jelly
